name: AI Tool Proficiency (Claude, Cursor, ChatGPT, etc)

levelDescriptions.0: Never attempts to use available AI tools despite repeated training or prompts
levelDescriptions.1: Can open and use ChatGPT, Curacel-specific AI tools (e.g., internal bots)
levelDescriptions.2: Uses AI tools without prompting
levelDescriptions.3: Regularly uses AI to save hours weekly
levelDescriptions.4: Builds or curates team-wide prompt libraries

0: Never attempts to use available AI tools despite repeated training or prompts
1: Can open and use ChatGPT, Curacel-specific AI tools (e.g., internal bots)
3: Regularly uses AI to save hours weekly
4: Builds or curates team-wide prompt libraries

levelDescriptions.0: Offloads repetitive work to teammates that should be AI-assisted
levelDescriptions.1: Follows AI usage guidance from team lead
levelDescriptions.2: Enhances personal productivity: e.g., generates meeting summaries, email drafts, formats data
levelDescriptions.3: Creates reusable prompts or workflows for their function
levelDescriptions.4: Designs or deploys semi-automated processes using AI + existing tools (e.g., Notion, Slack, Sheets)

3: Creates reusable prompts or workflows for their function
4: Designs or deploys semi-automated processes using AI + existing tools (e.g., Notion, Slack, Sheets)

levelDescriptions.0: Doesn’t engage with AI updates, resources, or demo days
levelDescriptions.1: Uses AI occasionally for basic tasks like summarizing notes or drafting simple responses
levelDescriptions.2: Shares occasional prompts with team
levelDescriptions.3: Begins to experiment with chaining tools (e.g., ChatGPT + Zapier)
levelDescriptions.4: Facilitates AI learning for others (internal workshops, demos)

0: Doesn’t engage with AI updates, resources, or demo days
1: Uses AI occasionally for basic tasks like summarizing notes or drafting simple responses
3: Begins to experiment with chaining tools (e.g., ChatGPT + Zapier)
4: Facilitates AI learning for others (internal workshops, demos)

levelDescriptions.0: Dismisses AI's role in insurance and shows no understanding of Curacel’s AI-powered products.
levelDescriptions.1: Recognizes that AI improves speed in claims or underwriting but can’t explain how it works.
levelDescriptions.2: Understands and communicates how Curacel products apply AI to fraud, pricing, and claims logic.
levelDescriptions.3: Improves models by surfacing edge cases, refining training data, or translating ops feedback.
levelDescriptions.4: Benchmarks model performance, defines use-case fit, and drives AI application across insurance verticals.

0: Dismisses AI's role in insurance and shows no understanding of Curacel’s AI-powered products.
1: Recognizes that AI improves speed in claims or underwriting but can’t explain how it works.
2: Understands and communicates how Curacel products apply AI to fraud, pricing, and claims logic.
3: Improves models by surfacing edge cases, refining training data, or translating ops feedback.
4: Benchmarks model performance, defines use-case fit, and drives AI application across insurance verticals.

levelDescriptions.0: Relies fully on AI or ignores it entirely, introducing risk and decision errors.
levelDescriptions.1: Uses AI with caution and flags uncertain outputs for human validation.
levelDescriptions.2: Builds fallback flows and helps others know when to trust or defer to humans.
levelDescriptions.3: Leads hybrid processes with clear override paths and feedback loops.
levelDescriptions.4: Designs layered AI-human systems with routing, tracking, and escalation logic.

0: Relies fully on AI or ignores it entirely, introducing risk and decision errors.
1: Uses AI with caution and flags uncertain outputs for human validation.
2: Builds fallback flows and helps others know when to trust or defer to humans.
3: Leads hybrid processes with clear override paths and feedback loops.
4: Designs layered AI-human systems with routing, tracking, and escalation logic.

levelDescriptions.0: Fails to see or outright ignores strategic AI opportunities in their function
levelDescriptions.1: Struggles to connect AI use with KPIs or strategy
levelDescriptions.2: Identifies small-scale areas in their workflow where AI can increase efficiency or quality
levelDescriptions.3: Uses AI to intentionally shift how their team hits KPIs or OKRs
levelDescriptions.4: Leads AI-driven process or initiative that significantly improves business metrics (e.g., 10x faster reporting, 3x proposal volume, higher close rates)

0: Fails to see or outright ignores strategic AI opportunities in their function

3: Uses AI to intentionally shift how their team hits KPIs or OKRs
4: Leads AI-driven process or initiative that significantly improves business metrics (e.g., 10x faster reporting, 3x proposal volume, higher close rates)

levelDescriptions.0: Ignores or resists AI even for repetitive or clearly automatable work.
levelDescriptions.1: Uses AI for simple tasks but doesn’t explore deeper improvements.
levelDescriptions.2: Redesigns workflows with AI to improve speed, accuracy, or consistency.
levelDescriptions.3: Builds internal tools and tracks AI-driven gains in core operational metrics.
levelDescriptions.4: Prototypes scalable AI systems and ties them to ROI, latency, or cost performance.

3: Builds internal tools and tracks AI-driven gains in core operational metrics.
4: Prototypes scalable AI systems and ties them to ROI, latency, or cost performance.

levelDescriptions.0: No observable AI usage over an extended period despite access, examples, and guidance
levelDescriptions.1: Aware of the need to use AI tools but hasn’t taken initiative
levelDescriptions.2: Can distinguish when AI adds value vs when it doesn't
levelDescriptions.3: Drives at least one workflow redesign using AI
levelDescriptions.4: Has measurable impact on KPIs via AI use

levelDescriptions.1: Follows guidance without initiative.
levelDescriptions.2: Flags inaccurate, inappropriate, or risky AI-generated content.
levelDescriptions.3: Regularly checks AI work for bias, hallucinations, or ethical red flags.
levelDescriptions.4: Reviews or helps design AI workflows with user fairness and transparency in mind

2: Flags inaccurate, inappropriate, or risky AI-generated content.
3: Regularly checks AI work for bias, hallucinations, or ethical red flags.
4: Reviews or helps design AI workflows with user fairness and transparency in mind

levelDescriptions.0: Uses AI tools solo but hides learnings.
levelDescriptions.1: Participates passively in AI learning spaces.
levelDescriptions.2: Occasionally shares prompts, ideas, or lessons with peers.
levelDescriptions.3: Regular contributor to AI discussions, resources, or prompt libraries.
levelDescriptions.4: Encourages and mentors other team members.

0: Uses AI tools solo but hides learnings.
1: Participates passively in AI learning spaces.
2: Occasionally shares prompts, ideas, or lessons with peers.
3: Regular contributor to AI discussions, resources, or prompt libraries.
4: Encourages and mentors other team members.

name: Enjoyment
description: You find genuine satisfaction and joy in your work, seeing it not just as a task but as a meaningful part of your life. This means approaching every project with enthusiasm, which reflects in the positivity and creativity you bring to the team and your work.

levelDescriptions.1: You appreciate the idea of finding joy in your work but often need guidance to see the enjoyable aspects of your tasks.
levelDescriptions.2: You start to identify aspects of your work that you enjoy and seek tasks that align with these interests, with occasional encouragement.
levelDescriptions.3: You consistently find joy in your work, making it a point to engage in tasks that resonate with your interests and strengths.
levelDescriptions.4: You not only derive deep satisfaction from your work but also inspire your colleagues to find enjoyment in their tasks, enhancing overall team morale.
levelDescriptions.5: You cultivate a workplace culture that values enjoyment in work, leading initiatives that help everyone find passion in their responsibilities.

name: Drive
description: You possess an intrinsic motivation that fuels your commitment to your work and the goals of Curacel. This means setting ambitious targets for yourself and tirelessly pursuing them, showing resilience and determination in the face of challenges.

levelDescriptions.1: You show initial motivation towards tasks but often require external motivation to sustain effort over time.
levelDescriptions.2: You demonstrate more consistent motivation and are beginning to set personal goals, though you sometimes need reminders or support to stay on track.
levelDescriptions.3: Your drive is self-sustaining; you set and pursue ambitious goals independently and are resilient in the face of obstacles.
levelDescriptions.4: Your high level of motivation serves as a model for others; you mentor colleagues in goal setting and perseverance.
levelDescriptions.5: You are a key driver in fostering a highly motivated workplace, implementing strategies that enhance organizational drive and ambition.

name: Exceed Expectations
description: You consistently go above and beyond what is required, aiming to surpass the set standards in every task you undertake. This means not just meeting deadlines but delivering work that sets a new benchmark for excellence, contributing significantly to Curacel's success.

levelDescriptions.1: You understand the importance of meeting expectations but require guidance to understand what exceeding them entails.
levelDescriptions.2: You occasionally go beyond the basic requirements of tasks with some oversight, showing an understanding of what it means to exceed expectations.
levelDescriptions.3: You consistently deliver work that surpasses requirements without needing external prompts, showcasing high standards and attention to detail.
levelDescriptions.4: You not only exceed expectations in your own work but also guide your peers in doing so, raising the bar for your team's performance.
levelDescriptions.5: You lead by example and set new benchmarks for excellence within Curacel, shaping policies or practices that encourage everyone to exceed expectations.

name: Curiosity
description: You possess a deep-seated desire to learn and discover new things, constantly questioning the status quo and seeking out new knowledge and skills. This means being open to new ideas and approaches, always looking for ways to improve both personally and professionally.

levelDescriptions.1: You show initial interest in new information and experiences but rely on external prompts to explore further.
levelDescriptions.2: You actively seek out learning opportunities within known boundaries and is more open to challenges, though sometimes dependent on guidance.
levelDescriptions.3: You independently explore new areas of knowledge, apply learning to work, and is self-driven in overcoming challenges.
levelDescriptions.4: You serve as a role model for continuous learning and problem-solving, encouraging and guiding others in their curiosity journeys.
levelDescriptions.5: You lead organizational learning initiatives, creating a culture that values and promotes curiosity and continuous improvement.

name: Ambitious Goals
description: You set high, challenging objectives for yourself and the team, pushing the boundaries of what's considered achievable. This means not being content with mediocrity but striving for significant achievements that contribute to Curacel's overarching mission.

levelDescriptions.1: You recognize the importance of goals but need help to set and pursue them effectively.
levelDescriptions.2: You set personal goals with some ambition and pursue them with encouragement, showing progress in challenging oneself.
levelDescriptions.3: You regularly set and achieve high goals independently, demonstrating a strong drive and commitment to personal and professional growth.
levelDescriptions.4: You inspire and assist others in setting and reaching ambitious goals, contributing to a high-performing team environment.
levelDescriptions.5: You shape the goal-setting culture of Curacel, developing frameworks that encourage ambitious goal-setting and achievement across the organization.

name: Adaptable Mindset
description: You demonstrate a high level of flexibility and resilience in the face of change, viewing obstacles as opportunities to grow and innovate. This means being able to pivot strategies, learn from setbacks, and continue moving forward with a positive outlook, ensuring sustained growth and progress.

levelDescriptions.1: You understand the concept of adaptability but struggle to adjust to change without guidance.
levelDescriptions.2: You shows flexibility in familiar situations and is learning to adjust strategies based on feedback, with some reliance on support.
levelDescriptions.3: You demonstrate resilience and flexibility across a range of scenarios, independently adapting to new challenges and changes.
levelDescriptions.4: You act as a change champion within teams, helping others to navigate and adapt to new situations effectively.
levelDescriptions.5: You lead organizational change initiatives, fostering a culture that embraces adaptability, resilience, and innovation at all levels.

name: Ownership
description: You take full responsibility for your tasks and projects, treating them as if they were your own business, demonstrating a strong commitment to the team's success. This means being accountable for the outcomes, proactively addressing issues, and ensuring that every aspect of your work is executed to the highest standard.

levelDescriptions.1: You acknowledge responsibility for tasks but often require direction and follow-up to ensure accountability.
levelDescriptions.2: You take responsibility for tasks and shows some proactive problem-solving, though occasionally needs encouragement to fully own projects.
levelDescriptions.3: You fully own projects and outcomes, proactively addressing challenges and taking responsibility for results without external prompts.
levelDescriptions.4: You empower others to take ownership, providing guidance and support to foster accountability and responsibility in the team.
levelDescriptions.5: You cultivate a strong sense of ownership across Curacel, embedding accountability and self-driven responsibility into the organizational culture.

name: Initiative
description: You are proactive, not waiting for directions to act. You identify opportunities for improvement and take the lead in implementing solutions. This means consistently looking for ways to contribute beyond your usual responsibilities and being a driving force for positive change within Curacel.

levelDescriptions.1: You show willingness to take on tasks but often wait for instructions before acting.
levelDescriptions.2: You begin to act on opportunities within a defined scope and is more proactive, though sometimes hesitate without clear direction.
levelDescriptions.3: You regularly seek out and act on opportunities for improvement and innovation, demonstrating a high level of proactivity and independence.
levelDescriptions.4: You lead by example in taking initiative, mentoring others to be proactive, and identifying and seizing opportunities.
levelDescriptions.5: You shape the organizational culture to prioritize and value initiative, implementing systems that encourage and reward proactive behavior.

name: Communication
description: You actively and respectfully engage in the exchange of ideas, expectations, and feedback, ensuring transparency and clarity in all interactions. Without prompt, you regularly provide updates and progress reports on your tasks, fostering a culture of openness and accountability. You place a high value on the contributions and perspectives of every team member, recognizing the importance of diverse viewpoints and collaborative synergy in achieving Curacel's goals.

levelDescriptions.1: You understand basic communication principles but may struggle to convey or receive messages clearly without assistance.
levelDescriptions.2: You communicate effectively in familiar contexts and is developing skills for more effective team and client interactions, with occasional support needed.
levelDescriptions.3: You excel in clear and effective communication across a variety of contexts, ensuring alignment and understanding within teams and with clients.
levelDescriptions.4: You act as a communication role model, coaching others in effective communication strategies and fostering an environment of open and constructive dialogue.
levelDescriptions.5: You lead the development and implementation of communication standards and practices at Curacel, enhancing organizational clarity, collaboration, and efficiency.

name: Expediency
description: You approach your work with a swift and efficient manner, understanding that time is of the essence in achieving Curacel's objectives. This means consistently looking for the most effective ways to accomplish tasks, ensuring that results are delivered not just on time, but as promptly as possible without compromising quality.

levelDescriptions.1: You recognize the need for timely action but may not consistently deliver results quickly without reminders.
levelDescriptions.2: You begin to complete tasks more promptly, showing an improving pace in work with some oversight needed for timely delivery.
levelDescriptions.3: You consistently meet or exceed time-sensitive goals, efficiently managing tasks and deadlines without compromising quality.
levelDescriptions.4: You drive team efficiency, helping others improve their work pace and meeting critical deadlines effectively.
levelDescriptions.5: You establishe standards and processes that enhance organizational efficiency, ensuring a high sense of urgency is maintained across all teams.

name: Agility
description: You exhibit flexibility and responsiveness to changes and new demands, adapting quickly to shifting priorities and market conditions. This means being able to adjust your strategies and actions on the fly, ensuring that Curacel remains competitive and responsive to opportunities and challenges.

levelDescriptions.1: You show awareness of the need for flexibility but struggle to adapt to new directions or unexpected changes without guidance.
levelDescriptions.2: You adapt to changes within known scenarios with some ease, though may require support in more complex situations.
levelDescriptions.3: You demonstrate strong adaptability, quickly adjusting to new information, challenges, and shifting priorities independently.
levelDescriptions.4: You guide and support others in becoming more agile, facilitating a nimble response to change within the team.
levelDescriptions.5: You lead the development of an agile organizational culture, embedding flexibility and responsiveness into Curacel's operational DNA.

name: Prioritization
description: You effectively identify the most critical tasks and challenges that align with Curacel's strategic goals, focusing your energy and resources on what matters most. This means making informed decisions about where to allocate your time and effort, ensuring that high-impact activities are addressed with the urgency they require.

levelDescriptions.1: You understand the concept of prioritizing tasks but often need help to effectively order tasks and manage workload.
levelDescriptions.2: You show improving skills in identifying more critical tasks and managing time more effectively, though occasionally may misalign priorities without guidance.
levelDescriptions.3: You consistently identify and focus on high-priority tasks, efficiently managing time and resources to meet strategic objectives without oversight.
levelDescriptions.4: You coach others in effective prioritization techniques, enhancing the team's ability to focus on key objectives and manage time efficiently.
levelDescriptions.5: You shape Curacel's approach to prioritization, developing systems and frameworks that ensure organizational focus on strategic goals and efficient resource allocation.

name: Optimism
description: You maintain a consistently positive outlook, even in the face of setbacks or uncertainty, believing that there is always a path forward. This means looking at every situation with the confidence that it can be overcome, and that every challenge is an opportunity for growth and improvement and it serves as a driving force for your team when they're dispirited.

levelDescriptions.1: You display a general sense of hope but may be easily swayed by challenges or setbacks, requiring support to maintain a positive outlook.
levelDescriptions.2: You maintain a positive attitude in familiar situations and is beginning to apply an optimistic outlook to overcome obstacles, with some encouragement.
levelDescriptions.3: You consistently exhibit a positive, optimistic mindset, using it as a driving force to navigate challenges and inspire others.
levelDescriptions.4: You actively spread optimism within the team, uplifting colleagues and contributing to a positive, can-do culture.
levelDescriptions.5: You instill a deeply rooted sense of optimism across Curacel, leading initiatives that build resilience and a positive outlook as core organizational values.

name: Solution-Orientation
description: You always look for solutions and opportunities not just for yourself or your team but also for the business instead of focusing on limitations or making excuses. This means actively encouraging your team to adopt a can-do attitude, fostering a culture where challenges are enthusiastically accepted and approached with a solution-oriented mindset.

levelDescriptions.1: You recognize problems and is open to solutions but often rely on others to provide answers or direction.
levelDescriptions.2: You actively seek solutions within a known framework and is becoming more adept at solving problems with occasional guidance.
levelDescriptions.3: You independently find creative and effective solutions to challenges, consistently applying a solution-oriented approach to work.
levelDescriptions.4: You guide others in identifying and implementing solutions, enhancing the team's problem-solving capabilities and creativity.
levelDescriptions.5: You shape the problem-solving culture at Curacel, developing and promoting methodologies that encourage innovative and effective solutions across the organization.

name: Persistence
description: You embody the perseverance to pursue goals and visions relentlessly, coupled with the flexibility to adapt strategies as needed. This means not only being persistent in the face of challenges but also being willing to adjust approaches based on new insights or changing circumstances, ensuring that optimism and solution-orientation are effectively channeled towards achieving Curacel's objectives.

levelDescriptions.1: You show initial determination in the face of obstacles but may quickly resort to seeking external help when faced with challenges.
levelDescriptions.2: You demonstrate increased resilience and continue efforts to overcome difficulties with some support, showing growing perseverance.
levelDescriptions.3: You display strong persistence in pursuing goals, adapting strategies as needed while maintaining focus and motivation through challenges.
levelDescriptions.4: You inspire and support others in their persistence, sharing strategies for resilience and adaptability in the face of adversity.
levelDescriptions.5: You lead by example and foster an environment where adaptive persistence is valued and encouraged, ensuring that Curacel's team members are equipped to persistently pursue and achieve their goals, even in changing circumstances.

levelDescriptions.1: Can build basic UI components with guidance.
levelDescriptions.2: Can develop simple user interfaces using Vue or React Native with support.
levelDescriptions.3: Can independently implement complex UIs and handle API integration and state management.
levelDescriptions.4: Can optimize frontend performance and lead UI component architecture across projects.
levelDescriptions.5: Can architect frontend frameworks and coach others in frontend best practices.

levelDescriptions.1: Can follow backend development patterns and build simple endpoints with assistance.
levelDescriptions.2: Can implement CRUD APIs and follow Laravel conventions independently.
levelDescriptions.3: Can design scalable services using Laravel, with good separation of concerns and DDD alignment.
levelDescriptions.4: Can lead service layer design, resolve architectural debt, and enforce backend coding standards.
levelDescriptions.5: Can define backend frameworks, mentor others, and drive backend architecture decisions across teams.

levelDescriptions.1: Can write basic queries and understand database tables with guidance.
levelDescriptions.2: Can model schemas and perform basic joins and indexing with supervision.
levelDescriptions.3: Can design normalized databases, write optimized queries, and manage migrations.
levelDescriptions.4: Can identify performance bottlenecks and tune database interactions for scale.
levelDescriptions.5: Can lead data modeling, partitioning, and storage design for complex, high-throughput systems.

levelDescriptions.1: Can consume a simple external API with help.
levelDescriptions.2: Can connect to and send data to 3rd-party systems using standard patterns.
levelDescriptions.3: Can build and maintain robust 3rd-party integrations, including auth and retries.
levelDescriptions.4: Can design integration frameworks and proactively manage external system dependencies.
levelDescriptions.5: Can architect scalable integration strategies, interface with enterprise platforms, and abstract integration logic.

levelDescriptions.1: Can write basic, functional code that runs, with help on structure.
levelDescriptions.2: Can follow code guidelines and apply basic formatting and linting.
levelDescriptions.3: Can write clean, testable code and provide constructive peer reviews.
levelDescriptions.4: Can enforce high code quality standards across modules and guide junior engineers.
levelDescriptions.5: Can define team-wide coding standards, automate quality enforcement, and lead refactoring efforts

levelDescriptions.1: Can push code to a repo and run a local app with support.
levelDescriptions.2: Can use existing CI/CD pipelines to deploy changes.
levelDescriptions.3: Can configure and troubleshoot CI/CD workflows for test and deployment automation.
levelDescriptions.4: Can optimize pipelines for speed, reliability, and rollback safety.
levelDescriptions.5: Can lead CI/CD strategy across teams and integrate delivery into larger platform engineering goals.

levelDescriptions.1: Can run Docker containers locally using documented commands.
levelDescriptions.2: Can build Docker images and deploy simple services in containers.
levelDescriptions.3: Can write Dockerfiles, manage local environments, and troubleshoot containerized services.
levelDescriptions.4: Can deploy and manage containerized apps on Kubernetes clusters.
levelDescriptions.5: Can define container orchestration strategy and mentor others in container best practices.

levelDescriptions.1: Can observe logs and alerts when guided but cannot yet identify root causes.
levelDescriptions.2: Can use logs and basic tools to diagnose minor production issues.
levelDescriptions.3: Can independently debug production issues and identify system bottlenecks.
levelDescriptions.4: Can implement observability tools (e.g., monitoring, tracing, alerting) and resolve complex outages.
levelDescriptions.5: Can design observability systems and lead postmortems, root cause analysis, and resilience strategy.

levelDescriptions.1: Can deploy to dev/staging but depends on others for production releases.
levelDescriptions.2: Can deploy low-risk updates with supervision and run sanity checks.
levelDescriptions.3: Can deploy features safely with rollback plans, health checks, and migration awareness.
levelDescriptions.4: Can coordinate and execute zero-downtime rollouts for major releases.
levelDescriptions.5: Can define company-wide deployment best practices and governance.

levelDescriptions.1: Can follow naming and modularity conventions but lacks understanding of domains.
levelDescriptions.2: Can structure code using basic domain logic boundaries with guidance.
levelDescriptions.3: Can apply DDD patterns (e.g., entities, services, value objects) to new features.
levelDescriptions.4: Can drive DDD adoption across modules and resolve domain overlap.
levelDescriptions.5: Can design entire systems around bounded contexts and coach others in DDD modeling.

levelDescriptions.1: Can write features that work but may not scale or remain maintainable.
levelDescriptions.2: Can write modular code and consider some edge cases for scale.
levelDescriptions.3: Can design components that are extensible, DRY, and resilient under load.
levelDescriptions.4: Can refactor systems for long-term maintainability and performance.
levelDescriptions.5: Can design platform-wide solutions that balance tech debt, growth, and maintainability.

levelDescriptions.1: Can write tests after development with help.
levelDescriptions.2: Can write basic unit tests and use assertions correctly.
levelDescriptions.3: Can use TDD as a core development practice across features.
levelDescriptions.4: Can enforce test coverage policies and write integration and E2E tests.
levelDescriptions.5: Can define automated testing strategy and train others in quality-first engineering.

levelDescriptions.1: Can follow security guidelines (e.g., password hashing) when instructed.
levelDescriptions.2: Can apply basic input validation, auth, and access control.
levelDescriptions.3: Can design secure endpoints and handle sensitive data appropriately.
levelDescriptions.4: Can identify security risks and lead mitigations or audits.
levelDescriptions.5: Can drive security architecture, threat modeling, and compliance across the stack.

levelDescriptions.1: Can answer basic questions from teammates when prompted.
levelDescriptions.2: Can support junior engineers through code reviews and pair programming.
levelDescriptions.3: Can mentor mid-level engineers and lead feature teams.
levelDescriptions.4: Can coach engineers on architecture, design, and delivery excellence.
levelDescriptions.5: Can build and lead engineering culture, leveling systems, and onboarding paths.

levelDescriptions.1: Can join design discussions but provides limited input.
levelDescriptions.2: Can give structured feedback in reviews and propose small improvements.
levelDescriptions.3: Can actively contribute to design sessions and architectural reviews.
levelDescriptions.4: Can lead design reviews and resolve architectural disagreements.
levelDescriptions.5: Can define design review frameworks and mentor teams on scalable decision-making.

levelDescriptions.1: Can complete assigned tasks on time but needs help prioritizing.
levelDescriptions.2: Can manage small modules or bugs with limited supervision.
levelDescriptions.3: Can lead end-to-end delivery of key features or components.
levelDescriptions.4: Can drive large initiatives and unblock others with little oversight.
levelDescriptions.5: Can own high-impact projects, align with business goals, and influence company roadmap.

levelDescriptions.1: Can document basic tasks or setup steps when asked.
levelDescriptions.2: Can write usage docs or how-tos for components with guidance.
levelDescriptions.3: Can document systems, decisions, and interfaces clearly for others.
levelDescriptions.4: Can institutionalize team documentation practices and conduct knowledge sessions.
levelDescriptions.5: Can lead knowledge systems and build a culture of transparency and documentation.

levelDescriptions.1: Can launch basic AWS services (e.g., EC2, S3) with supervision.
levelDescriptions.2: Can configure services like RDS, IAM, and Lambda with some guidance.
levelDescriptions.3: Can independently architect and manage AWS environments using best practices.
levelDescriptions.4: Can optimize, secure, and scale AWS infrastructure across environments.
levelDescriptions.5: Can lead cloud strategy, cost governance, and advanced multi-account AWS architecture.

levelDescriptions.1: Can navigate the GCP UI and deploy resources from templates.
levelDescriptions.2: Can replicate basic AWS setups in GCP and use core services like GCS or Cloud Run.
levelDescriptions.3: Can manage hybrid cloud workloads and support CI/CD across both platforms.
levelDescriptions.4: Can architect GCP-native infrastructure and advise on vendor-neutral deployments.
levelDescriptions.5: Can lead cloud abstraction initiatives and drive multi-cloud resilience strategies.

levelDescriptions.1: Can define security groups and IAM roles with support.
levelDescriptions.2: Can manage VPCs, subnets, route tables, and enforce IAM policies.
levelDescriptions.3: Can implement secure networking, role-based access control, and encryption at rest/in-transit.
levelDescriptions.4: Can design zero-trust network policies, rotate credentials, and monitor audit trails.
levelDescriptions.5: Can lead cloud security reviews, design defense-in-depth architectures, and ensure regulatory compliance.

levelDescriptions.1: Can deploy serverless functions with templates.
levelDescriptions.2: Can configure environments and test basic functions.
levelDescriptions.3: Can manage scalable serverless APIs and functions using Vapor or alternatives.
levelDescriptions.4: Can optimize cold starts, observability, and vendor limits in serverless deployments.
levelDescriptions.5: Can lead adoption of serverless architecture, governance, and cost modeling.

levelDescriptions.1: Can trigger basic pipelines and inspect logs with guidance.
levelDescriptions.2: Can modify simple pipelines and add build/test steps.
levelDescriptions.3: Can build CI/CD pipelines with branching, caching, and rollback logic.
levelDescriptions.4: Can optimize parallelism, deploy safely to production, and enforce policies.
levelDescriptions.5: Can define pipeline architecture standards and manage CI/CD reliability at scale.

levelDescriptions.1: Can recognize common CI/CD tools like Jenkins or GitHub Actions.
levelDescriptions.2: Can modify pipelines in different platforms with support.
levelDescriptions.3: Can translate pipeline logic between platforms effectively.
levelDescriptions.4: Can evaluate CI/CD platforms for use cases and performance.
levelDescriptions.5: Can drive platform migration, standardization, and organization-wide adoption.

levelDescriptions.1: Can deploy to staging and notify team for production promotion.
levelDescriptions.2: Can manage basic blue/green or canary deployments manually.
levelDescriptions.3: Can automate progressive rollouts with monitoring and rollback triggers.
levelDescriptions.4: Can coordinate high-availability releases with no downtime.
levelDescriptions.5: Can design platform-level deployment frameworks with SLA guarantees.

levelDescriptions.1: Can store and retrieve artifacts manually.
levelDescriptions.2: Can use tagging/versioning for consistent deployments.
levelDescriptions.3: Can manage artifact lifecycle, caching, and secure storage.
levelDescriptions.4: Can automate artifact promotion between environments.
levelDescriptions.5: Can design centralized artifact governance and traceability practices.

levelDescriptions.1: Can read existing IaC templates.
levelDescriptions.2: Can provision basic infrastructure from templates.
levelDescriptions.3: Can write reusable, modular infrastructure definitions with state management.
levelDescriptions.4: Can design IaC frameworks and enforce drift detection and plan validation.
levelDescriptions.5: Can lead cross-project infrastructure standardization and policy as code adoption.

levelDescriptions.1: Can write basic shell scripts to automate repeat tasks.
levelDescriptions.2: Can create scripts for provisioning, log rotation, or service monitoring.
levelDescriptions.3: Can build secure, idempotent scripts for production workflows.
